net.wstech2.me.httpsclient

Class CertificateStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.wstech2.me.httpsclient.CertificateStore

  • public class CertificateStore
extends java.lang.Object
    CertificateStore interacts with the Certificate Authorities repository, providing methods for insertion, removal, deletion and maintenance of the stored certificates. This repository contains CA's (Certificate Authorities) public keys and server certificates stored in both jar resources and record store. Certificates shipped with the application are stored as resources, and those added during the application lifetime are stored as records in the Record Store.

      • getInstance

      • put

        public void put(java.lang.String cn,
       org.bouncycastle.asn1.x509.Certificate certificate)
         throws java.io.IOException,
                javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreNotOpenException,
                javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreFullException,
                javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreException
        Insert a new certificate into the Certificate Store. This new certificate will be saved, internally, as a record in the Record Store.
        Parameters:
        cn - common name
        certificate - The certificate to be saved (stored). This certificate will be serialized as an array of bytes and then stored as an record.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreException
        javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreFullException
        javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreNotOpenException

      • get

        public org.bouncycastle.asn1.x509.Certificate get(java.lang.String cn)
                                           throws javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreNotOpenException,
                                                  javax.microedition.rms.InvalidRecordIDException,
                                                  javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreException
        Gets a certificate from the Certificate Store corresponding to the subject and serial number passed as parameters.
        Parameters:
        cn - common name
        Returns:
        The certificate corresponding to the common name informed. Null if no certificate could be found.
        Throws:
        javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreException
        javax.microedition.rms.InvalidRecordIDException
        javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreNotOpenException

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.String cn)
            throws javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreNotOpenException,
                   javax.microedition.rms.InvalidRecordIDException,
                   javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreException
        Remove the certificate from the Certificate Store. It will only remove certificates from the Record Store. The certificates shipped as resources in the application jar can not be removed.
        Parameters:
        cn - common name.
        Throws:
        javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreException
        javax.microedition.rms.InvalidRecordIDException
        javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreNotOpenException

      • loadCertificateIdsMap

        public void loadCertificateIdsMap()
        Loads the certificate identifiers from the recordStore's Record ID 1. Those identifiers will be used to locate and, if needed, load certificates saved in the recordStore.
